item.title: Vedic provenance
item.description: Source: GhorAngirasa The deepest roots of Mūrti worship can be traced to Śrautam. A few examples: Physical characteristics of Devas in Ṛk-Sam̐hitā - Indra with golden hair, etc; Rudra with turban, etc - The basic idea of gods having forms is right there in Ṛk-Sam̐hitā. Installation of a golden Puruṣa in the Agnicayana at base of Uttaravedi. The Golden Puruṣa installed under the Uttaravedī altar is Prajāpati himself. Here, you have the idea of a anthropomorphic representation of a deity.
